hackathon-description-text: For experts and curious minds, collaborate with new people to learn about and create wearable and connected technology. Come challenge yourself with awesome hardware to hack on!
hackathon-rules:
Here is our Code of Conduct:
http://bit.ly/1LYtT8F
Here is WearHacks NYC Terms and Conditions:
http://bit.ly/1iGrNTB

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
Is it something new? Have you never seen an idea like this before?
Does it strike you as being original?
Does the project go beyond traditional rules, patterns, and/or definitions?
Is the new idea meaningful?

Does the project require skill to assemble (and is mostly assembled)?
Does the project demonstrate a lot of thought?
Were multiple devices/APIs meaningfully used as part of the project?

How close is the project to being usable/final project?
Is the project usable for many (different) people?
How complete is the project?

How aesthetically pleasing is the project?
Did thought go into project design?
Does the project combine quality design with quantitative complexity?

Would this help improve quality of life?
Is this something the participants are interested in pursuing further?
Does the project consider a broader world view?
